appearances.title: Rep. Robin Kelly & Others on Articles of Impeachment Against Secy. Noem : CSPAN3 : January 14, 2026 8:03pm-8:35pm EST
appearances.snippet: kelly: for me and others, it was like congresswoman bonnie watson coleman said. enough is enough. if we do nothing, nothing will happen. so just really now try to build momentum, getting as many people sign on as possible, that is the first step. >> we cannot be cynical at this moment. we have to stand up for our country. if we are cynical that nobody is going to join, nothing happens. we proved that with the aca extended premium tax credit extension. people thought there was no way we would pass that in the house and we have to continue to message what is right. the american people can see what is happening is wrong. they want us to act. i had a town hall withstanding perpetual applause for impeaching kristi noem. the people want us to do something that is our job. >> you talk about using every tool of the toolbox. this effort does not gain momentum, what options is the house considering? defunding i.c.e. through the appropriations process, abolishing i.c.e. -- what options are on the table? rep. kelly: all options are on the table. we just have to see what is going to work. we h

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 6, 2026 6:29pm-8:20pm EST
appearances.snippet: and i'd like to leave one minute to the gentlelady from new jersey, miss bonnie watson coleman. >> i first want to thank both of our, um, members of congress who are co-leading this very important special order. our. five years ago, a violent mob attacked the united states capitol to prevent the peaceful transfer of power. yet on the first day of donald trump's second term, he pardoned more than 1500 criminals involved in that insurrection and carried that carried out in his name. this is just one action amid a comprehensive campaign to erase the memory of what happened on that day. it's a slap in the face to law enforcement who selflessly put their lives at risk to defend all of us. some of them lost their lives, like officer brian sicknick, a new jersey native who tragically died following injuries he sustained that day. many more are still dealing with trauma. in brian's honor, i introduce a resolution condemning those blanket pardons. we must never forget their sacrifice. we cannot let donald trump and his allies rewrite the history of one of the darkest moments in the 250th hist
